title: Academic Performance Improvement Strategies Through LMS Interaction Data Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental Digital Literacy and LMS Usage Experience
context.additional_context: Targeting advanced language learners in medical, legal, and technical professions; emphasizes improving practical language skills through project-based assessments

learning_goals: Learners can systematically analyze LMS interaction types (access frequency, content engagement, collaborative activities) according to the CILC classification framework.
Learners can visually represent the correlation between their LMS usage patterns and academic performance.
Learners can improve project execution efficiency by 20% or more by establishing personalized LMS optimization strategies based on analysis results.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
